page.title: 07ST. PETER'S CHURCH, OFFHAM
page.content: To get to Hamsey Church you have to go through a muddy farmyard so Sir Henry Shiffner, the local squire, decided to have a new church built in Offham. Many local people gave money and the {large gothic building was completed in {1858.}Inside are many interesting features such as the font which bears one of many{Gospel quotations.}The church is decorated by fine windows, some stained, others of cheaper clear glass, replacements after damage caused by a violent storm in 1981. The processional cross beside the choir stalls was carved by a local craftsman from the wood of the old choir pews in Hamsey Church. At the time of the building there was usually a large congregation.{Now {fewer people come to church}and the rector is able to have another job simultaneously as a college lecturer.
